main event: A bright light object was observed passing over the town of Osgood, Indiana on March 13, 1961 around 7:55 PM EST.
interesting points: The object appeared to be about the size of a medium star and was observed for about 3 minutes as it passed from the north to the south at a relatively slow speed.
The object would disappear at intervals and then reappear during its flight.
The witness believed the object was not an airplane, satellite, meteor, or star, as it could be distinctly seen at intervals and did not appear like the stars in the sky.
The National Space Surveillance Center tracked an object over Osgood, Indiana on March 25, 1961 that disappeared from sight at approximately the same time as the reported sighting.
The witness's account of the sighting is considered to be authentic.
